00007 #include "NonmemTranslator.h"

00010 #include <xercesc/dom/DOMDocument.hpp>
00011 #include <xercesc/dom/DOM.hpp>
00012 #include <xercesc/util/XMLString.hpp>
00013 
00014 using namespace std;
00015 using namespace xercesc;
00016 
00018 //
00019 //  detAnalysisType()
00020 //  Determines the type of analysis and the number of subjects.
00021 //
00022 //  Pre-conditions
00023 // 
00024 //  * source points to a valid XMLDocument
00025 //
00026 //  Post-conditions
00027 //
00028 //  * ClientTranslator::ourTarget is set to either POP or IND
00029 //  * ClientTranslator::ourPopSize is set to the number of subjects
00030 //
00032 int NonmemTranslator::detAnalysisType()
00033 {
00034   DOMElement  * spksource      = getSourceTree()->getDocumentElement();
00035   DOMNodeList * pop_analysises = spksource->getElementsByTagName( XML.X_POP_ANALYSIS );
00036   DOMNodeList * ind_analysises = spksource->getElementsByTagName( XML.X_IND_ANALYSIS );
00037   DOMElement  * analysis;
00038   unsigned int popSize = 0;
00039   enum TARGET target;
00040 
00041   if( pop_analysises->getLength() > 0 )
00042     {
00043       if( ind_analysises->getLength() > 0 )
00044     {
00045       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00046       snprintf( mess, 
00047             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00048             "<%s> and <%s> elements cannot be found together in a sourceML document.", 
00049             XML.C_POP_ANALYSIS, XML.C_IND_ANALYSIS );
00050       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__);
00051       throw e;
00052     }
00053       target = POP;
00054       analysis = dynamic_cast<DOMElement*>( pop_analysises->item(0) );
00055       assert( analysis != NULL );
00056 
00057       //
00058       // Finding out the population size
00059       //
00060       if( !analysis->hasAttribute( XML.X_POP_SIZE ) )
00061     {
00062       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00063       snprintf( mess, 
00064             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00065             "Missing <%s::%s> attribute specification.", XML.C_POP_ANALYSIS, XML.C_POP_SIZE );
00066       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__);
00067       throw e;
00068     }
00069       const XMLCh * xml_pop_size = analysis->getAttribute( XML.X_POP_SIZE );
00070       if( !XMLString::textToBin( xml_pop_size, popSize ) )
00071     {
00072       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00073       snprintf( mess, 
00074             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00075            "Invalid <%s::%s> attribute value: \"%s\"", XML.C_POP_ANALYSIS, XML.C_POP_SIZE,
00076            XMLString::transcode(xml_pop_size) );
00077       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__);
00078       throw e;
00079     }
00080     }
00081   else //( ind_analysises->getLength() > 0 )
00082     {
00083       target = IND;
00084       popSize = 1;
00085 
00086     }
00087   setTarget ( target );
00088   setPopSize( popSize );
00089   return popSize;
00090 }
